inject: A highly convincing deepfake video appears online, showing a NATO commander admitting the exercise is a cover for 'offensive preparations.'

filter.intro: Sophisticated attack. Deepfake, high production value. Adversary invested heavily in this, yes? They want panic.
filter.outro: Pre-bunking shines here. If you warned about deepfakes before, audiences skeptical now. Fact-checking also effective - technical analysis exposes fake. Counter-narrative helps but doesn't address the fake directly. Discrediting looks defensive. Ignoring? Disaster. Silence confirms suspicions.

metadata.teachingPoint: Deepfakes require technical debunking; pre-bunking is most effective defense
